fields.headline: Fulham set to sign Goma
fields.bodyText: Fulham have agreed a club record £4million transfer fee for Newcastle's French international central defender Alain Goma. Goma, 28, will moved to Craven Cottage subject to agreeing personal terms and passing a medical. His signing surpasses the £3million Fulham paid Sunderland for midfielder Lee Clark. The move could be manager Jean Tigana's first step in a rebuilding programme as he prepares his his side for the Premiership next season. Managing director Michael Fiddy said in a club statement: "The club is looking forward to welcoming Alain to Fulham, once he has completed a medical. "His record has been proven at both domestic and international levels and we are sure he will become a great asset to the team for the rest of the season and for years to come. "Alain's signing is indicative of the ambition of the football club to achieve the chairman's vision of both Premiership and European honours in the future." Goma joined Newcastle for £4.7million in July 1999 after spending 10 years with French outfit Auxerre.
